bug.author: 8bitmp3
bug.summary: [TF 2.0] Minor changes to the 'Load images with tf.data' tutorial + fix image links
bug.description:
<denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/beta/tutorials/load_data/images>https://www.tensorflow.org/beta/tutorials/load_data/images</denchmark-link>
Description of main issue: Pls take a look at JPG/JPEG links in the 'Load images with tf.data' tutorial in the 'Inspect the images' section. When you inspect the site elements they appear to be missing a letter 'g' as in jpeg or jpg <denchmark-code>https://www.tensorflow.org/beta/tutorials/load_data/images_files/output_16_0.jpe https://www.tensorflow.org/beta/tutorials/load_data/images_files/output_16_2.jpe https://www.tensorflow.org/beta/tutorials/load_data/images_files/output_16_4.jpe </denchmark-code>
Rearrangement of words, fixing some grammar, addition/subtraction of commas/colons/spaces in English and Python for consistency - will submit a PR right away for your review <denchmark-link:https://github.com/MarkDaoust>@MarkDaoust</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/lamberta>@lamberta</denchmark-link>

comments.comment: Thank you. We recently hit this filename issue ... something about nb_convert and mime types. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/yashk2810>@yashk2810</denchmark-link> is looking in to it.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/MarkDaoust>@MarkDaoust</denchmark-link> has a fix on the way. This should be fixed soon.

Thanks for the report. Yes mimetypes <denchmark-link:https://github.com/jupyter/nbconvert/pull/175>jupyter/nbconvert#175</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://www.onebigfluke.com/2014/02/crazy-python-mimetypes-module.html>https://www.onebigfluke.com/2014/02/crazy-python-mimetypes-module.html</denchmark-link>
The fix is in, and the site-updater is running now. This will be resolved by EOD.
